intro: [WRONG START] Spatallpsis caudiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered spatallopsis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant features striking, pendulous flowers that are typically yellow or orange with dark red markings. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Spatallopsis caudiflora thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
